ai.summary: A relaxed 4.9 km coastal walk along Holywell Bay in North Cornwall, starting at Holywell Beach and following the shore to enjoy sandy beaches, sea views and dramatic coastlines. The route is easy and suitable for families and casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly sandy beach and firm coastal paths with occasional dune tracks and boardwalk sections. Expect variable surfaces, soft sand near the tide line and some steps or gentle elevation changes. Tides can affect the route, so check tide times and stay aware of water levels.
ai.safety_notes: Check the tide times and plan around them. Stay on marked paths and avoid steep cliff edges. Be cautious of sneaker waves and strong currents along exposed sections. Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers with a windproof layer; bring sun protection in fine weather. Mobile reception can be patchy in coastal areas, so carry a small map or offline GPS and inform someone of your plans. Bring water and a small first aid kit.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offer milder weather and longer daylight; winters are cooler and can be stormy, with rough seas.

seo.title: Holywell Beach Walk, North Cornwall – 4.9 km Easy Coastal Hike
seo.meta_description: Enjoy a gentle 4.9 km coastal stroll at Holywell Bay in North Cornwall, UK. Easy terrain, sea views and practical safety tips for a relaxed beach hike.
seo.h1: Holywell Beach Walk (North Cornwall) – 4.9 km Easy Coastal Hike
